meanings.definition: An act of rising in active resistance or revolt.
meanings.sent1: The small town experienced an insurgence against the new tax laws.
meanings.sent2: The citizens organized an insurgence to protest the unfair treatment.
meanings.sent3: The insurgence of the squirrels in the park led to a comical standoff with the birds.
meanings.sent4: The insurgence of creativity in her mind was like a burst of colorful fireworks.
meanings.sent5: The sudden insurgence of energy propelled him to finish the project ahead of schedule.

meanings.definition: A rebellion or uprising against authority.
meanings.sent1: After the harsh policies were announced, an insurgence broke out in the city.
meanings.sent2: The history books were filled with tales of past insurgences against tyrannical rulers.
meanings.sent3: The insurgence of the students against the strict dress code made the principal reconsider.
meanings.sent4: The insurgence of emotions in her heart was like a storm brewing on the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected insurgence of support from the community boosted their morale.
